description:
The Women's Tour returns to Black Mountain, last climbed in 2019 in a stage won by Hannah Barnes, for the only summit finish of the race. 7.2km-long and with ramps up to 21%, today is when the battle for the race leader's yellow jersey will be decided.

description:
Today the riders get their first real taste of what‚Äôs to come during the last two stages in the high-mountains. There aren‚Äôt any high-mountains to speak of between Rives and Gap, but there is a lot of hilly terrain and two Cat-2 tests which will give the climbers an opportunity to stretch their legs.

The Global Cycling Network (GCN) is the largest online cycling channel in the world, bringing together a global community of road cyclists to celebrate everything that‚Äôs great about the world of cycling.

Our videos bring fans compelling daily content including expert tutorials, techniques, training, racing, cutting-edge bike tech, unparalleled behind the scenes event coverage, humour,  entertainment, and more.

Presented by ex-pro riders, GCN offers a uniquely qualified insight into the world of cycling, and most importantly it‚Äôs fuelled by our passionate and enthusiastic fans ‚Äì everyone who makes up the GCN community. We also bring the latest and greatest tech to your attention, showcase the best places in the world to ride and get exclusive access to events and races.

description:
The first of two stages in Wales sees the peloton tackle a 143km route with 2,108m of climbing, making it the hilliest stage of the race. The final categorised climb comes with 50km to go, but there are plenty more opportunites for the winning move to be made on the run-in to Welshpool.

title: Close Finish On Relentless Day Of Racing | The Women's Tour 2022 Stage 4 Highlights

description:
While it features the least climbing of any stage at this year‚Äôs race, just 2,200m, stage 5 is far from straightforward with two categorised climbs in the last 25km threatening to cause havoc. Keeping the bunch together over these two late climbs will be tough, which means that we could see some splits and a small group of riders go on to contest the finish in Chaintr√©.

Brought to you by the world‚Äôs biggest cycling channel, the Global Cycling Network (GCN), GCN Tech is the only channel you need for all things bike tech ‚Äì past, present and future.

Simply put, we‚Äôre obsessed with tech: we seek out and showcase the best in bikes, components, tech, accessories, upgrades and more from races and events, tech shows and product launches across the globe to bring you the best in road bike technology.

We‚Äôve also got great maintenance videos to help you get the most from your bike; pro-bike tours from all the biggest races; special features and the weekly GCN Tech Show. We also take a deeper look into the future of cycling, apps, smart tech and virtual riding. 

Join us on the channel and the GCN App to submit your content, vote on the latest tech and keep abreast of exciting new trends.

Brought to you by the world‚Äôs biggest cycling channel, the Global Cycling Network (GCN), GCN Tech is the only channel you need for all things bike tech ‚Äì past, present and future.

Simply put, we‚Äôre obsessed with tech: we seek out and showcase the best in bikes, components, tech, accessories, upgrades and more from races and events, tech shows and product launches across the globe to bring you the best in road bike technology.

We‚Äôve also got great maintenance videos to help you get the most from your bike; pro-bike tours from all the biggest races; special features and the weekly GCN Tech Show. We also take a deeper look into the future of cycling, apps, smart tech and virtual riding.

description:
At the weekend, Ivar Slik upset the gravel racing purists after he won Unbound Gravel‚Ä¶ with aero bars! Gravel bars are perfectly legal but it‚Äôs argued they are against the spirit of the event. To clear up this confusion and controversy, and to help save gravel‚Äôs soul, we came up with our own 8 rules to follow when racing gravel. Simple!

The Global Cycling Network (GCN) is the largest online cycling channel in the world, bringing together a global community of road cyclists to celebrate everything that‚Äôs great about the world of cycling.

Our videos bring fans compelling daily content including expert tutorials, techniques, training, racing, cutting-edge bike tech, unparalleled behind the scenes event coverage, humour,  entertainment, and more.

Presented by ex-pro riders, GCN offers a uniquely qualified insight into the world of cycling, and most importantly it‚Äôs fuelled by our passionate and enthusiastic fans ‚Äì everyone who makes up the GCN community.
